==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|辵|卬|alt1=辶|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=p}}.

===Etymology===
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*ŋra-k/ŋ||to meet; to encounter}}. Cognate with {{cog|my|ငြင်း||to refuse to obey; to argue}}. Within Chinese, it is related to:

* {{och-l|禦|to defend}}
* {{och-l|迕|to meet; to go against}}
* {{och-l|迓|to receive; to defend}}
* {{och-l|溯|to go upstream}}
* {{och-l|逆|to greet; to go against; to resist}}

|c=jing4

|md_note=ngiàng - colloquial ("to parade through the streets; to become dry; to stick up"); ngìng - literary ("to welcome, to meet, to face, to flatter")
|mn=ngiâ/gêng
|mn_note=ngiâ - colloquial ("to parade through the streets; to meet, to greet"); gêng - literary
|w=3nyin

====Definitions====
{{zh-hanzi}}

# to [[receive]]; to [[welcome]]; to [[greet]]; to [[meet]]
#: {{zh-x|歡迎|welcome}}
# to [[flatter]]; to [[ingratiate]] with
# to [[face]]; to [[go]] against; to do something in face of ...; to [[forge]] [[ahead]]
# {{lb|zh|Min}} to [[escort]] (a god, hero etc.) through the streets; to [[parade]] through the streets
# {{lb|zh|Min Dong|of food}} to become [[dry]] (due to exposure to the wind)
# {{lb|zh|Min Dong|of hair}} to [[stick]] up; to become [[erect]]
# {{surname|lang=zh}}
